item.title: PouchDB 3.5.0: Vote for PouchDB
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: Do you support better documentation for PouchDB users? Do you value faster CORS and better Service Worker support? If so, then today you should cast your vote in support of PouchDB. Together, we can make a better future (release of PouchDB).

item.title: PouchDB 3.4.0: Better late than never
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: Everyone needs a break, and for March PouchDB relaxed and enjoyed the arrival of spring. However, regularly scheduled programming has resumed, and today I am happy to announce PouchDB 3.4.0.

item.title: Taming the asynchronous beast with ES7
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: One of the trickiest aspects of PouchDB is that its API is asynchronous. I see no shortage of confused questions on Stack Overflow, Github, and IRC, and most often they stem from a misunderstanding of callbacks and promises.

item.title: Efficiently managing UI state with PouchDB
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: A common pattern in data-driven apps is to display the entire database in the UI. If you're using PouchDB, that means you want to mirror the contents of PouchDB to some in-memory representation used by the UI.

item.title: PouchDB 3.3.1: A quick one while he's away
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: This is a quick release, ahead of our normal monthly release schedule, to fix some critical bugs and ship them out sooner to our eager PouchDB fanbase.

item.title: PouchDB 3.3.0: Fix Up, Look Sharp
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: A new month means a new PouchDB release. Over the last month we have been looking around the rough edges and cleaning things up or chopping them off along with the usual slew of bugfixes and a lot of great news.

item.title: PouchDB 3.2.1: You can always be faster
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: A humble release to ring in the new year, PouchDB 3.2.1 is focused on bugfixes and performance improvements. In particular, 3.2.1 boasts some critical fixes for IE11 and node-webkit, as well as a fix for replication of conflicted documents.

item.title: The Pains Of Being Async At Heart
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
